intro: Cleistesiopsis divaricata f. leucantha, commonly known as the white-flowered cleistesiopsis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub with opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. The inflorescence consists of dense clusters of flowers, making it an attractive ornamental plant.
